meanings.definition: To grant or give something as a favor or privilege.
meanings.sent1: The kind teacher vouchsafed extra time for the struggling student.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor vouchsafed a large sum to the charity.
meanings.sent3: The cat vouchsafed to share its sunny spot with the dog.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl vouchsafed its knowledge to the curious squirrel.
meanings.sent5: The magical fairy vouchsafed a wish to the young child.

meanings.definition: To condescend to grant or bestow something.
meanings.sent1: The queen vouchsafed a smile to her loyal subjects.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity vouchsafed an autograph to the excited fan.
meanings.sent3: The boss vouchsafed to join the office potluck.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy businessman vouchsafed a nod to the street performer.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher vouchsafed a day off for good behavior.
